questions.question_text:
Examine this incomplete query:

SELECT DATE '2019-01-01' +
FROM DUAL;

Which three clauses can replace to add 12 hours to the date? (Choose three.)
Which two are true about the data dictionary? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct

Selected Answer: AD
AD correct see discussion linked below
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/oracle/view/9425-exam-1z0-071-topic-1-question-230-discussion/

choices.D: The SYS user owns all base tables and user-accessible views in the data dictionary.
choices.A: The data dictionary is constantly updated to reflect changes to database objects, permissions, and data.
choices.B: All user actions are recorded in the data dictionary.
choices.C: All users have permissions to access all information in the data dictionary by default.
choices.E: Base tables in the data dictionary have the prefix DBA_.

choices.C: It can be accessed by any user who has the SELECT privilege in any schema.
choices.D: It can display multiple rows and columns.
choices.E: It consists of a single row and single column of VARCHAR2 data type.
choices.F: It can be used to display only constants or pseudo columns.
choices.B: It can be accessed only by the SYS user.
choices.A: It can display multiple rows but only a single column.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the DUAL table: (Choose two.)
Which statement is true about TRUNCATE and DELETE?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
You cannot truncate the parent table of an enabled foreign key constraint. You must disable the constraint before truncating the table. An exception is that you can truncate the table if the integrity constraint is self-referential.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. The key word is 'if' foreign contstraints will be be violated. Meaning, the TRUNCATE 'will' violate the foreign constraints.

Selected Answer: B
B correct answer should be B

Selected Answer: B
the exception to C is if the constraint is self referential which contradicts the user of 'never' in the statement

Selected Answer: B
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/oracle/view/15064-exam-1z0-071-topic-1-question-268-discussion/

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B
(Truncate operations drop and re-create the table, which is much faster than deleting rows one by one, particularly for large tables)

choices.B: For large tables TRUNCATE is faster than DELETE.
choices.A: For tables with multiple indexes and triggers DELETE is faster than TRUNCATE.
choices.C: You can never TRUNCATE a table if foreign key constraints will be violated.
choices.D: You can never DELETE rows from a table if foreign key constraints will be violated.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
TESTED : Correct answer is B

NOCACHE --> NEXTVAL =2;
INCREMENT BY 10 --> NEXTVAL =11;
START WITH 11 --> ORA ERROR - CANNOT ALTER SEQUENCE STARTING NUMBER
MINVALUE 11 --> ORA ERROR - MINVALUE CANNOT BE MADE TO EXCEED THE CURRENT VALUE
CYCLE 11 --> ORA ERROR - SQL COMMAND NOT PROPERLY ENDED

Selected Answer: B
I think B is correct
Tested twice. B

Selected Answer: B
Tested.

I creating sequence - create sequence customer_seq cache 10;
What I get from alter sequence customer_seq:
A. NOCACHE – NEXTVAL 1
B. INCREMENT BY 10 - NEXTVAL 10.
C. START WITH 11 - ORA-02283: cannot alter starting sequence number 
D. MINVALUE 11 - ORA-04007: MINVALUE cannot be made to exceed the current value 
E. CYCLE 11 - ORA-00933: SQL command not properly ended

Selected Answer: C
CORRECT C, FALSE B
